description: As p runs through the primes >= 5, sequence gives { numerator of Sum_{k=1..p-1} 1/k } / p^2.
comments: This is an integer by a theorem of Waring and Wolstenholme.Conjecture: If p is the n-th prime and H(n) is the n-th harmonic number, then denominator(H(p)/H(p-1))/numerator(H(p-1)/p^2) = p^3. A193758(p)/a(n) = p^3, p > 3. - _Gary Detlefs_, Feb 20 2013
references: Z. I. Borevich and I. R. Shafarevich, Number Theory. Academic Press, NY, 1966, p. 388 Problem 5.
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers, 5th ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1979, th. 115.
links: R. Mestrovic, Wolstenholme's theorem: Its Generalizations and Extensions in the last hundred and fifty years (1862-2011), arXiv:1111.3057, 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 15 2001
